title: 169: Kierkegaard's "Fear and Trembling"
dc:creator: A.J. Hanenburg
description: Kierkegaard faced the absurdity of the universe, the absurdity of faith, and held both in tension. In this episode we explore his book "Fear and Trembling" as it traces the mystifying story of Abraham and Isaac.
itunes:author: All three are knights of eternal resignation.
itunes:subtitle: Or why it's okay to be a regular Joe.
itunes:summary: Kierkegaard faced the absurdity of the universe, the absurdity of faith, and held both in tension. In this episode we explore his book "Fear and Trembling" as it traces the mystifying story of Abraham and Isaac.
itunes:title: 169: Kierkegaard's "Fear and Trembling"
